sense.gloss: futon, Japanese bedding consisting of a mattress and a duvet
x: 敷き布団・しきぶとん
掛け布団・かけぶとん

sense.gloss: round cushion used for Zen meditation (traditionally made of woven bulrush leaves)
zabuton, flat floor cushion used when sitting or kneeling; usu. rectangular
Japanese iris, blue flag, Iris ensata
loach or eel dipped and broiled in soy-based sauce
kamaboko, steamed seasoned fish paste, usu. in a semicylindrical shape on a strip of wood and sliced to go in soup, etc.

sdata.j: ↑蒲団↑↓ふとん↓を↑干↑↓ほ↓して↑下↑↓くだ↓さい。
その↑庭園↑↓ていえん↓は↑菖蒲↑↓しょうぶ↓の↑名所↑↓めいしょ↓です。
sdata.e: The garden is famous for its irises.

sdata.j: ↑蒲団↑↓ふとん↓を↑干↑↓ほ↓して↑下↑↓くだ↓さい。
↑蒲団↑↓ふとん↓を↑干↑↓ほ↓して↑下↑↓くだ↓さい。
「↑美味↑↓おい↓しそうな↑蒲鉾↑↓かまぼこ↓みっけ。↑食↑↓た↓べていい？」「ダメよ。お↑節用↑↓せちよう↓なんだから」「けち」
sdata.e: “Ooh, those fish cakes look tasty! Can I try them?” “No, don’t! They’re for New Year’s!” “Jeez, stingy much?”

words.gloss: futon, Japanese bedding consisting of a mattress and a duvet
zabuton, flat floor cushion used when sitting or kneeling; usu. rectangular
